Unfortunatly, this does not work.

And you can take it from me.

First off there is no reason to create a torrent with a virus in it - even if it is a false positive which it appears to be - secondly the format in which this is presented is incorrect. 

If you use Process Monitor you can clearly see why it fails.

Even though I thank the uploader for his/her efforts, I would strongly suggest to adhere to the standards with regards to fine pirated software in that he/she creates an ISO of the original content with a NOCD crack in a separate directory which, after installation of the software, can be installed by the end-user.

Stay away from this one - not worth the effort.

There is still another torrent available in MDF format which you can get and that one should work fine after applying patch 1.2 and the NOCD fix by deviant. Both can be download via http. 

The other torrent is:
http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/4889489/The_Matrix_Path_Of_Neo_multi5_pc

For firetorrent users:
http://torrent.thepiratebay.se/4889489/The_Matrix_Path_Of_Neo_multi5_pc.TPB.torrent
rocking game

Works in Win7... HOWEVER:

- NO ENGLISH TEXT (*it's removed from the language files and replaced with Cyrillic text)
- US/EU save WILL NOT WORK with this version (*they appear in-game but crash upon loading)

Solutions for language files:

Download a version of the game that works (or not) but has the Eng language files then copy over the English files in this torrent.

Alternatively, d/l the "2GB" (*won't let me post url) audio-less version (*needs Warez registration) and swap this torrent's SOUND FILES (*and it's .EXE, as it reports a virus in the other one) to the Warez version.

The latter is what I did and it works A-OK.  GamesCopyWorld saves/ulockers work with this method also. ..albeit a 5GB d/l all up.

Bonus info:

If you're having issues with gamepad configurations, it's because the game isn't dual analogue stick compatible AND because it auto-detects the gamepad.  This conspires to make controller assignments clash with the keyboard's.  Most noticeable with camera an gun controls.

Solution:
Only plug controller in _AFTER_ you launch the game.  This will mean the game does not recognise the gamepad; in turn allowing for Xpadder (or the like) gamepad inputs without out the clash.
